DataElement.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Children's Version List A Trials 1-5 T Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T score for Trials 1-5 subtest using list A in the California Verbal Learning Test - Children's Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version List A Trials 1-5 T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Provides a short, individually administered assessment of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event. It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through 16._The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the child and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Provides a short, individually administered assessment
of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of
verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event.
It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials
and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a
variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through
16.

Concepts.longName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version
Concepts.definition: Provides a short, individually administered assessment of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event. It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through 16.

Property.preferredDefinition: The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the child and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the child and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.
